distances.meta

Class MinkowskiDegreeAutoFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • distances.meta.MinkowskiDegreeAutoFinder

  • public class MinkowskiDegreeAutoFinder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a recently proposed unsupervised approach for choosing the optimal exponent to use for calculating Minkowski distances in the data. The approach is based on selecting either the exponent leading to the lowest anti-hub rate or the lowest hub rate, as they are correlated. This approach was proposed in the paper titled "Choosing the Metric in High-Dimensional Spaces Based on Hub Analysis" by Dominik Schnitzer and Arthur Flexer that was presented at the 22nd European Symposium on Artificial Neural Networks, Computational Intelligence and Machine Learning in 2014. In that paper, hubs were formally defined as points that occur at least twice as often as expected, which is somewhat less formal and flexible than using the more standard approach of marking points whose occurrence counts exceed the average by at least two standard deviations as hubs. Nevertheless, for consistency with the paper, we use the Nk(x) >= 2k as a criterion for hubs in this class.

        Initialization.
        Parameters:
        dset - DataSet to learn the optimal Minkowski exponent for.
        minExp - Float value that is the minimum exponent to try.
        maxExp - Float value that is the maximum exponent to try.
        stepExp - Float value that is the step for the exponent search.

        public void setNeighborhoodSize(int k)
        Parameters:
        k - Integer value representing the neighborhood size to use in the calculations.

      • getBestDistanceMatrix

        public float[][] getBestDistanceMatrix()
        Returns:
        float[][] representing the upper triangular distance matrix that corresponds to the best calculated Minkowski exponent value.

      • getBestExponent

        public float getBestExponent()
        Returns:
        Float value that was determined to be the best according to the selected hubness-aware criterion.

      • getBestMetricObject

        public CombinedMetric getBestMetricObject()
        Returns:
        CombinedMetric object corresponding to the best computed Minkowski exponent.

      • setVerboseMode

        public void setVerboseMode(boolean verbose)
        Parameters:
        verbose - Boolean value indicating whether to print out which exponent is currently being tested during iterations. This is meant to be used for script executions of the evaluation and the default false value should be used when the code is invoked from other classes in some internal calculations.

      • examineParameterRange

        public void examineParameterRange()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        This method calculates the hub and anti-hub rates for the specified Minkowski exponent range.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        A script that utilizes the implemented method to find the optimal Minkowski exponent on a specified dataset, for which the user provides a path from the command line. Users can also specify the exponent ranges, as well as the neighborhood size and the selection criterion.
        Parameters:
        args - String[] representing the command line parameters, as specified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
